law.catch_line: Death Of Recipient Of Advancement Before Intestate
law.text: [ Text of section effective until March 31, 2012. Repealed by 2008, 521, Sec. 15. See 2008, 521, Sec. 44 as amended by 2010, 409, Sec. 23 and 2011, 224.] If a child or other lineal descendant who has received an advancement dies before the intestate, leaving issue, the advancement shall be considered as part of the intestate's estate in the division and distribution of such estate, and the value thereof shall be taken by the representative of the heir to whom the advancement was made toward his share of the estate, as if the advancement had been made directly to him.
